data.overview:
Twenty-three competition venues were used for the Olympic Games Mexico City 1968, 21 of which remain in use today. Fifteen of the competition venues were existing and eight were new. Two of the existing venues have been demolished. All eight of the venues newly built for the Games still host sports competitions and cater for high-performance athletes, sports clubs and the community.

The Olympic Stadium hosted the Opening and Closing Ceremonies and two sports, and continues to be regularly used. The Olympic Village was built for the Games and remains in use.
